Dear Donna Marie McBride:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.

III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff member told another youth at the facility that they would pay
them to assault Youth A and would back them by saying that
Youth A hit them first.
Investigation Interviews:
On 10/15/2024 an email was received from DCWL Consultant 2.
She forwarded a copy of an email correspondence from the Chief
Administrator.
On 10/17/2024 and 10/25/2024 unannounced visits was made to
Genisis Home. No one was present at the agency.
On 10/17/2024 a telephone call was held with Complainant. No
additional concerns were noted.
Telephone calls were made to the Program Manager on
10/17/2024, 10/29/204, and 10/30/2024. She advised that Youth B
had been discharged from the program and Staff 1 was
suspended. Contact numbers for Youth B and Staff 1 were
provided. Program Manager advised that prior to her discharge,
Youth B reported that Staff 1 tried to get her to fight Youth A and
offered her money to fight Youth A. She denied knowledge of any
concerns expressed by other youth or staff regarding Staff 1. She
denied any disciplinary action in the Staff 1’s personnel file.
Program Manager confirmed that the agency does not have any
cameras in their facility. Program Manager lastly advised that on
the day of the incident, Youth A was transported to Corwell
hospital via ambulance for a precautionary evaluation due to
suspected overuse of her asthma inhaler. Youth A was discharged
from the hospital, and no concerns were noted.
Voicemail messages were left for Staff 1 on 10/29/2024,
11/01/2024, 11/13/2024, and 12/07/2024 requesting a return
phone call.
2

On 10/30/2024 a voicemail message was left for Youth B
requesting a return call. A return call was received, and I was
advised that the telephone number was not a valid contact
number for Youth B.
On 10/30/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
A at Genisis Home. Youth A reported she has been at the facility
since August 2024. She reported that she does not get along well
with Staff 1 and feels like they have concerns every time she
works. She clarified by concerns; she means that they just don’t
get along well. Youth A confirmed that Youth B was also present
on the day in question. Youth A recalled that she wanted to
exchange some clothes and asked to use the telephone. Staff 1
said no because Youth A was trying to go above her and call other
staff. Youth A stated she picked up the phone to make a call
without permission and Staff 1 unplugged the phone. Youth A
reported that she then went upstairs, and Staff 1 came up and
made Youth B come up also. Youth A needed to use her inhaler
due to going up and down the stairs. She reported that Staff 1
attempted to use her body to block her on the stairs. Youth A was
still able to squeeze by Staff 1. While going down the stairs, Youth
A reported that she felt Staff 1 push her in the back. Youth A
further reported that Youth B told her that her and Staff 1 were
laughing because Staff 1 tried to push Youth A down the stairs
and pushed Youth A in the back. Youth A denies knowing
anything about staff telling Youth B to fight her. She also denied
hearing Staff 1 or Youth B say anything about fighting her.
On 10/30/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Staff 2
at Genisis Home. She denied knowledge of Staff 1 making
threats toward youth or offering money to youth to beat up other
youth. She denied that she has ever engaged in such behavior
and denied knowledge of any other staff doing so.
Documents Reviewed:
Email Correspondence from DCWL Consultant 2: The
assigned consultant for the agency forwarded an email
correspondence for review on 10/15/2024. It included a
notification from the Chief Administrator of Gensis Home. The
notification advised that on 10/13/2024 Youth A was acting up.
Youth B advised staff that while she and Staff 1 were following the
ambulance that was transporting Youth A, Staff 1 offered her
money to beat up Youth A. Youth B also reported that Staff 1 said
she purposely tried to trip Youth A when she was walking down
the stairs.
3

Spectrum Incident/Accident Report – Incident Report dated
10/14/2024 was completed and submitted by Program Manager.
It indicated that police were called and Youth A was taken to the
hospital to be examined due to overuse of her inhaler and
spraying excessive amounts of Lysol. The IR also included
written statements submitted by Youth A, Youth B and Staff 1.
Written Statement by Youth B: “On the way to the hospital while
Youth A was in the ambulance, Staff 1 said she would pay me to
beat the shit out of Youth A and would tell everyone that Youth A
hit me first.”
Written Statement by Staff 1: “When told that she could not
make a call to another staff, Youth A proceeded to stomp and
cuss throughout the home. While on the phone with
management, Youth A “bucked” at staff. Youth A attempted to
make a call to her father without permission, refused to hang up
the phone and refused to hand phone over to staff, so I unplugged
the phone. I held the phone while Youth A held the cord of the
phone for about 10 minutes. Youth A then let go of the phone and
ran upstairs. Youth B was directed to her room so that I could sit
in the hallway and maintain line of sight of both youth. Youth A
then began to run up and down the stairs so that staff could follow
her. After running up and down the stairs, Youth A required the
use of her inhaler. She also went into the bathroom and sprayed
and excessive amount of Lysol spray. Due to overuse of the
inhaler and after speaking to management, 911 was called for
client safety.”
Written Statement by Youth A: “Staff 1 came into the house and
the first thing she said to me was ‘Do you have an attitude?’ I told
her no, but I’m tired. Staff 1 was making slick comments about my
cooking, but I didn’t trip out. Staff 1 told me I could not call
another Staff on the phone because I was trying to go to people
upper than her. I got mad and went back to cooking and watching
TV. Then I called my dad without asking. Staff 1 unplugged the
phone and tried to take it from me out of my hand. We stood
there for about 10 minutes and then I got up and went upstairs. I
went into the bathroom, and I took three puffs of my inhaler
because my breathing was low. When I went back upstairs, she
tried to trip me and push me. I asked her not to touch me and she
said she didn’t, when I know she did. I went to the bathroom,
used it and then sprayed. When I came out of the bathroom the
cops came and asked me some questions. They said I was fine,
but Staff 1 wanted me to go to and be checked out.”
4

Tour of Facility:
On 10/30/2024 a tour of the facility was completed. Specifically,
the stairs and bathroom areas were observed.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with licensing rule 4126-1. After interviews of
Youth A and review of written statements by Youth B and other
staff, there was sufficient evidence to support that Staff 1 failed to
provide for the continual needs, protection, and supervision of
Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff pushed youth in the back.
Investigation Interviews:
On 10/30/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
A at Genesis Home. She reported being placed in the facility
since August 2024. Youth A reported that on 10/13/20204 Staff 1
was the staff on duty and they were engaged in a disagreement
about the desire of Youth A to use the telephone to call her dad.
Youth A reported when she was attempting to go down the stairs,
Staff 1 used her body to attempt to block the stairs. Youth A was
still able to squeeze by Staff 1. Once she was past her and
walking down the stairs, Youth A reported that Staff 1 pushed her
in the back. Youth A denied falling and denied having any marks
or bruises as a result of the push in her back.
Documents Reviewed:
Written Statement by Youth A: When I went back up the stairs
Staff 1 tried to trip me and pushed me in the back.
5

Written Statement by Youth B: While Youth A was stepping
over Staff 1 on the stairs, Staff 1 raised her leg to trip Youth A
down the stairs. Youth A asked Staff 1 if she tried to trip her and
Staff 1 laughed and said yes.
Email Correspondence from DCWL Consultant 2: The
assigned consultant for the agency forwarded an email
correspondence for review on 10/15/2024. It included a
notification from the Chief Administrator of Gensis Home. The
notification advised that on 10/13/2024 Youth A was acting up.
Youth B advised staff that while she and Staff 1 were following the
ambulance that was transporting Youth A, Staff 1 said she
purposely tried to trip Youth A when she was walking down the
stairs.
Spectrum Community Services Behavior Management Policy:
Staff will refrain from the use of physical discipline and utilize CPI
Non-violent Crisis Intervention, when appropriate.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with licensing rule 4158-1-a-ii.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A corrective action plan is required.
